meanings.sent1: The overtrims dress looked too small on her.
meanings.sent2: She wore an overtrims jacket that was too tight.
meanings.sent3: The overtrims hat made him look like a tiny elf.
meanings.sent4: Her overtrims hair made her head seem oddly shaped.
meanings.sent5: The overtrims curtains barely covered the window.

meanings.definition: To cut off excess material from
meanings.sent1: She carefully overtrims the fabric to make it fit.
meanings.sent2: The tailor overtrims the edges to ensure a clean finish.
meanings.sent3: He overtrims the paper with precision, like a surgeon.
meanings.sent4: The gardener overtrims the bushes into intricate shapes.
meanings.sent5: The chef overtrims the fat from the meat before cooking.

meanings.sent1: The overtrims of the tree made it look unnatural.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the overtrims on the edges of the carpet.
meanings.sent3: The overtrims of the cake were so large, it toppled over.
meanings.sent4: The overtrims of the painting gave it a unique texture.
meanings.sent5: He removed the overtrims from the design to simplify it.
